author: mklement0
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# Ditto for Start-Process
PSonUnix> Invoke-Item /
```

# Expected behavior

The platform's GUI file manager should launch asynchronously and the invoking terminal should continue to be usable.

# Actual behavior

The GUI file manager launches, but the invoking terminal becomes unusable - no further keyboard input is accepted.

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.0.0-preview.1 on macOS 10.14.5
PowerShell Core 7.0.0-preview.1 on Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This appears to be a regression in CoreFx.  We haven't made any changes in this area.  https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/40193.  This doesn't seem related to #9970

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: dotnet team says this is fixed in 3.0 Preview.9 which will come out next month I think, so if that fix works, this should be fixed in PS7 Preview.4

comments.author: maxwellb
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT I just tested the "frameworkdependent" release of powershell-7.0.0-preview.2 with the nightly 3.0.100-preview9-013948 of dotnet core. Looks good to me.
